cacheThisProduct

public boolean cacheThisProduct(Product product)
                         throws KKException
Should this particular product be cached? The default implementation returns false for null products and Bundle products (according to the setting of the configuration value) and simply returns true for every other product. The idea of this interface is that it is provided to be overridden so that you can choose not to cache certain products.

Only relevant in the Enterprise version.

Specified by:
cacheThisProduct in interface ProductMgrIf
Overrides:
cacheThisProduct in class ProductMgr
Parameters:
product - the product to be considered for caching
Returns:
true if the product should be cached otherwise false
Throws:
KKException

getProductImages

public ProductImages getProductImages(ProductImagesOptionsIf options)
                               throws KKException
Description copied from interface: ProductMgrIf
Get the image file names associated with the product whose id is specified. Only return image file names that match the specified regular expression if specified and not null. If the file name filter is null, all file names associated with the product are returned. If no product exists with the specified productId an exception is thrown. If no files are found for the product an empty array of image names is returned in the ProductImages return object.

Specified by:
getProductImages in interface ProductMgrIf
Overrides:
getProductImages in class ProductMgr
Parameters:
options - a ProductImagesOptions object for specifying the criteria used to define which product images should be returned. Within this search object you can specify productId and a file name filter (which is a regular expression).
Returns:
a ProductImages object that contains an array of image file names associated with the specified product and matching the (possibly) specified name filter regular expression.
Throws:
KKException - if options is null or if no product with the specified productId can be found.
